ibis.deploy
Class JobDescription

java.lang.Object
  ibis.deploy.JobDescription

public class JobDescription
extends java.lang.Object

Single job in an experiment.

Author:
Niels Drost

getPoolName

public java.lang.String getPoolName()
Returns the name of the pool of this job. If null, the name of the experiment is used by default.

the name of the pool of this job.

getPoolSize

public int getPoolSize()
Returns the size of the pool of this job. Only used in closed-world applications, defaults to 0 for "unknown"

Returns:
the size of the pool of this job.

setPoolSize

public void setPoolSize(int poolSize)
Sets the size of the pool of this job. Only used in closed-world applications, defaults to 0 for "unknown"

Parameters:
poolSize - the new size of the pool of this job.

checkSettings

public void checkSettings()
                   throws java.lang.Exception
Checks if this description is suitable for deploying. If not, throws an exception.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if this description is incomplete or incorrect.

resolve

public JobDescription resolve(ApplicationSet applicationSet,
                              Jungle jungle)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

resolve

public JobDescription resolve(Application application,
                              Resource resource)
Resolves the stack of JobDescription/Application/Resource objects into one new JobDescription with no dependencies. Ordering (highest priority first):
  1. Overrides and settings in this description
  2. Application settings in given Application
  3. Resource settings in given Resource

Parameters:
application - application to use for resolving settings.
resource - resource to use for resolving settings.
Returns:
the resulting job description, as a new object.

save

public void save(java.io.PrintWriter out,
                 java.lang.String prefix,
                 boolean ensureExists)
          throws java.lang.Exception
Print the settings of this job to a (properties) file

Parameters:
out - stream to write this file to
prefix - prefix to add to all keys, or null to use name of job.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if this job has no name
